1.name: Reservoir Dogs
1.description: When a simple jewelry heist goes horribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.

2.name: Aladdin
2.description: A kindhearted street urchin and a power-hungry Grand Vizier vie for a magic lamp that has the power to make their deepest wishes come true.

3.name: Dracula
3.description: The centuries old vampire Count Dracula comes to England to seduce his barrister Jonathan Harker's fiancée Mina Murray and inflict havoc in the foreign land.

4.name: Batman Returns
4.description: Batman returns to the big screen when a deformed man calling himself the Penguin wreaks havoc across Gotham with the help of a cruel businessman.

5.name: A League of Their Own
5.description: Two sisters join the first female professional baseball league and struggle to help it succeed amidst their own growing rivalry.

6.name: Così fan tutte
6.description: A happily married 24-year-old woman who experiences an inexplicable, rather restless craving to finally live her life intensely, retells her extra-marital escapades to her husband intending to spice up their marriage.

7.name: Basic Instinct
7.description: A violent police detective investigates a brutal murder, in which a manipulative and seductive novelist could be involved.

8.name: My Cousin Vinny
8.description: Two New Yorkers are accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college, and one of their cousins--an inexperienced, loudmouth lawyer not accustomed to Southern rules and manners--comes in to defend them.

9.name: The Last of the Mohicans
9.description: Three trappers protect the daughters of a British Colonel in the midst of the French and Indian War.

10.name: Alien³
10.description: After her last encounter, Ellen Ripley crash-lands on Fiorina 161, a maximum security prison. When a series of strange and deadly events occur shortly after her arrival, Ripley realizes that she has brought along an unwelcome visitor.

11.name: Unforgiven
11.description: Retired Old West gunslinger William Munny reluctantly takes on one last job, with the help of his old partner and a young man.

12.name: Candyman
12.description: The Candyman, a murderous soul with a hook for a hand, is accidentally summoned to reality by a skeptic grad student researching the monster's myth.

13.name: A Few Good Men
13.description: Military lawyer Lieutenant Daniel Kaffee defends Marines accused of murder. They contend they were acting under orders.

14.name: Scent of a Woman
14.description: A prep school student needing money agrees to "babysit" a blind man, but the job is not at all what he anticipated.

15.name: Death Becomes Her
15.description: When a woman learns of an immortality treatment, she sees it as a way to outdo her long-time rival.

16.name: Wayne's World
16.description: Two slacker friends try to promote their public-access cable show.

17.name: Sister Act
17.description: When a worldly singer witnesses a mob crime, the police hide her as a nun in a traditional convent where she has trouble fitting in.

18.name: The Mighty Ducks
18.description: A self-centered Minnesota lawyer is sentenced to community service coaching a rag tag youth hockey team.

19.name: The Bodyguard
19.description: A former Secret Service agent takes on the job of bodyguard to an R&B singer, whose lifestyle is most unlike a President's.

20.name: Patriot Games
20.description: When CIA analyst Jack Ryan interferes with an IRA assassination, a renegade faction targets him and his family for revenge.

21.name: School Ties
21.description: Set in the 1950s, a star-quarterback is given an opportunity to attend an elite preparatory school but must conceal the fact that he is Jewish.

22.name: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me
22.description: A young FBI agent disappears while investigating a murder miles from Twin Peaks that may be related to the future murder of Laura Palmer; the last week of the life of Laura Palmer is chronicled.

23.name: Army of Darkness
23.description: A man is accidentally transported to 1300 A.D., where he must battle an army of the dead and retrieve the Necronomicon so he can return home.

24.name: Pet Sematary II
24.description: A teenage boy and his father move to his recently-deceased mother's hometown, where they encounter the ancient Native American cemetery with the power to raise the dead.

25.name: Malcolm X
25.description: Biographical epic of the controversial and influential Black Nationalist leader, from his early life and career as a small-time gangster, to his ministry as a member of the Nation of Islam.

26.name: Lethal Weapon 3
26.description: Martin Riggs and Roger Murtaugh pursue a former LAPD officer who uses his knowledge of police procedure and policies to steal and sell confiscated guns and ammunition to local street gangs.

27.name: Universal Soldier
27.description: Private Luc Deveraux and his sadistic sergeant, Andrew Scott, got killed in Vietnam. The army uses their bodies for a secret project - reanimating dead soldiers as deadly obedient cyborgs. However, their memories come back too.

28.name: Body of Evidence
28.description: A lawyer defends a woman accused of killing her older lover by having sex with him.

29.name: Bitter Moon
29.description: After hearing stories of her, a passenger on a cruise ship develops an irresistible infatuation with an eccentric paraplegic's wife.

30.name: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
30.description: One year after Kevin McCallister was left home alone and had to defeat a pair of bumbling burglars, he accidentally finds himself stranded in New York City - and the same criminals are not far behind.

31.name: Buffy the Vampire Slayer
31.description: A flighty teenage girl learns that she is her generation's destined battler of vampires.

32.name: Under Siege
32.description: An ex-Navy Seal turned cook is the only person who can stop a group of terrorists when they seize control of a U.S. battleship.

33.name: The Crying Game
33.description: A British soldier kidnapped by IRA terrorists soon befriends one of his captors, who then becomes drawn into the soldier's world.

34.name: Chaplin
34.description: A movie about the troubled and controversial life of the master comedy filmmaker Charlie Chaplin.

35.name: A River Runs Through It
35.description: The story about two sons of a stern minister -- one reserved, one rebellious -- growing up in rural Montana while devoted to fly fishing.

36.name: The Lawnmower Man
36.description: A simple man is turned into a genius through the application of computer science.

37.name: Braindead
37.description: A young man's mother is bitten by a Sumatran rat-monkey. She gets sick and dies, at which time she comes back to life, killing and eating dogs, nurses, friends, and neighbors.

38.name: Encino Man
38.description: When they find a frozen caveman in their back yard, two high school outcasts thaw him and introduce him to modern life while he in turn gets them to actually enjoy life.

39.name: Beethoven
39.description: A slobbering St. Bernard becomes the center of attention for a loving family, but must contend with a dog-napping veterinarian and his henchmen.

40.name: White Men Can't Jump
40.description: Black and white basketball hustlers join forces to double their chances of winning money on the street courts and in a basketball tournament.

41.name: Newsies
41.description: A musical based on the New York City newsboy strike of 1899. When young newspaper sellers are exploited beyond reason by their bosses they set out to enact change and are met by the ruthlessness of big business.

42.name: Howards End
42.description: A businessman thwarts his wife's bequest of an estate to another woman.

43.name: Far and Away
43.description: A young Irish couple flee to the States, but subsequently struggle to obtain land and prosper freely.

44.name: Bad Lieutenant
44.description: While investigating a young nun's rape, a corrupt New York City police detective, with a serious drug and gambling addiction, tries to change his ways and find forgiveness and redemption.

45.name: Ladybugs
45.description: To climb the corporate ladder to success, a guy agrees to coach the company's all girl soccer team with the help of his secret weapon: his fiancee's son.

46.name: Glengarry Glen Ross
46.description: An examination of the machinations behind the scenes at a real estate office.

47.name: Singles
47.description: A group of twenty-something friends, most of whom live in the same apartment complex, search for love and success in grunge-era Seattle.

48.name: Jamón Jamón
48.description: When a mother disapproves of her daughter's lover, she hires an underwear model and former bullfighter to seduce her daughter.

49.name: Love Potion No. 9
49.description: Two scientists who are hopeless with the opposite sex experiment with a substance that makes them irresistible to anyone who hears them speak.

50.name: Honeymoon in Vegas
50.description: Jack loses $65000 in poker in Las Vegas, where he's marrying Betsy. The wedding'll have to wait as the poker winner wants the weekend with Betsy to cancel the debt. She accepts. Whom will she marry?
